Welcome! See our news for announcements, deadlines, and events.

title: About
text:
Our mission is to expand opportunities and training for the next generation of integrated intelligence engineers and scientists. We bridge research and practice through fellowships, short courses, and collaborative projects across academia, industry, and the public sector.
Guiding principles

Human‑centered, trustworthy AI
Cross‑disciplinary integration (engineering, social science, policy)
Open, reproducible research
Bilateral collaboration and career pathways

title: Welcome to the Integrated Intelligence Institute
text: We are live! Explore our programs, apply to fellowships, and follow our research updates.

title: Partners
text: We collaborate with universities, labs, startups, and public agencies. Interested in partnering? Contact us to co‑design a program or host fellows.

title: Apply
text:
Upcoming cohorts - Winter 2026 Fellowship (Jan–Mar): applications open Oct 25 - Summer 2026 Fellowship (Jun–Aug): applications open Feb 15
Eligibility - Undergraduate, master’s, or doctoral students in relevant fields - For U.S. placements, OPT/CPT or equivalent work authorization as applicable
How to apply 1. Prepare statement (500–800 words), CV, and portfolio (GitHub/papers) 2. Request 1–2 references 3. Submit via our portal (coming soon)

title: Programs
text:
Fellowships (OPT/CPT‑compatible)

10–12 week research placements with mentors in academia/industry
Stipends; seminar series; capstone presentation; post‑program publishing support



Short Courses & Bootcamps

Topics: ML engineering, data pipelines, evaluation & red‑teaming, AI governance
Formats: 1–2 day intensive, 4–6 week evening tracks



Workshops & Summer Institute

Annual, theme‑based convenings with hands‑on labs and policy roundtables

title: Research
text:
We support applied and policy‑relevant research on:

Human‑AI teaming & evaluation
Safety, privacy, and auditing for ML
AI readiness & innovation ecosystems
Supply chains, semiconductors, and compute infrastructure

Outputs - Working papers and briefs (DOIs via Zenodo) - Open datasets and code (GitHub org) - Practitioner guides and teaching materials
